abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column questions viability of NFL's requirement that players make themselves available to reporters at Super Bowl media day; observes that Seattle Seahawks running back Marshawn Lynch repeatedly stated 'I'm here so I won't get fined' while making forced appearance.
lead_paragraph: Marshawn Lynch responded to question after question by saying, “I’m here so I won’t get fined,” drawing attention to the rule that players must be available to reporters at the Super Bowl.
snippet: Marshawn Lynch responded to question after question by saying, “I’m here so I won’t get fined,” drawing attention to the rule that players must be available to reporters at the Super Bowl.

headline.main: One Question for the N.F.L.: Why Insist on a Media Day Charade?
headline.print_headline: One Question for the N.F.L.: Why Insist on a Media Day Charade?
